definition: a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)

sentences.english: Holding crossbows and arrows and other long-distance shooting weapons, they took up the job of defending the whole battle formation.
sentences.chinese: 他們手執弓弩等遠射兵器，擔任整個軍陣的警戒任務。

sentences.english: Bow and crossbow is the most in common use in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 弓弩是古代最常用的遠距離作戰武器。

sentences.english: "Give me the bird and I will go away, " the hunter said.
sentences.chinese: “給我那隻鳥我就會走，”獵人說弓弩。

sentences.english: Suddenly a bombard sounded and the flags parted. Archers and crossbowmen fired simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 忽聽得一聲炮響，紅旗開處，弓弩齊發。

sentences.english: She was practically poetic in describing Gnea's crossbow and two-handed short sword.
sentences.chinese: 她幾乎要用詩歌來描述妮雅的弓弩與那把雙柄短劍。

sentences.english: The soldiers in the vanguard wear short suits, have their hair in buns and hold bows.
sentences.chinese: 士兵身穿短褐，勒帶束髮，手執弓弩，揹負箭囊。

definition: firearms (in historical context)/flintlock (old powder and shot firearm)
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
